alert.note: Alert for Grand Canyon Country (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Excessive Heat Warning issued May 27 at 1:31AM MST until May 27 at 7:00PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: ...EXCESSIVE HEAT WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 11 AM THIS MORNING TO 7 PM MST THIS EVENING BELOW 4000 FEET... * WHAT...Dangerously hot conditions with temperatures of 105 to 110 degrees are expected below 4000 feet. * WHERE...The Grand Canyon...especially near Phantom Ranch. * WHEN...From 11 AM to 7 PM MST Friday. * IMPACTS...Extreme heat will significantly increase the potential for heat related illnesses, particularly for those working or participating in outdoor activities.
info.instruction: This warning is reserved for very hot conditions and is issued when temperatures are expected to rise to dangerous levels. Day hikers on Bright Angel Trail should descend no farther than 1 1/2 miles. Between 11 am and 7 pm...physical activity is discouraged. Hikers should attempt to be out of the canyon...at Indian Garden or Bright Angel campgrounds between these hours. All hikers should have adequate gear...including a wide-brimmed hat...sunscreen...salty snacks...sufficient water and electrolyte mix. Doubling your calorie intake helps maintain your energy. Hike smart.
